body: @airmoi  update to yii 2.0.8 and test again :)

Sorry, il misstyped yii's version, I also updated to 2.0.8, and I stile had the issue

Romain Dunand

> Le 4 mai 2016 à 07:10, spiritdead notifications@github.com a écrit :
> 
> @airmoi update to yii 2.0.8 and test again :)
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub

Not sure I understand what is going on here. Why would you load the exact same URL via script tag and expect it to return different data? Also if the response is JSONP, yii will not cache it. Please give more information about how this works. also links to the libraries you are using would be helpful.

Because of post data, the url is still the same, but post data differs, so results also differs.

I'm using this lib : 
https://github.com/philippfrenzel/yii2fullcalendar
with fullcamendar gcal extension  : https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fullcalendar/fullcalendar/master/src/gcal/gcal.js (http://fullcalendar.io/docs/google_calendar/)
Any update on this? I'm running into the same issue. Airmoi, you said you changed gcal's code. What was your workaround?

As far as I understand, your requests are JSONP, can you explain why this condition does not match then? https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/993f2aef28851a888878eaedb84db8233dfc12a3/framework/assets/yii.js#L379

You can specify the URL to your JSON resource in [reloadableScripts](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/993f2aef28851a888878eaedb84db8233dfc12a3/framework/assets/yii.js#L50) and it should solve the problem
.... That moment where you realize the solution was right in your face _face palm_. This will work. Thanks for the help. I've totally overlooked that this entire time.

Hi, 

Sorry for late answer
Thank for reopening the issue as the reloadableScripts workaround is not suitable in my case (script url is not predictable as it is generated by a third party script).

Has I mentioned in the first thread, the issue is that the filter is applied regardless data params in the ajax query. It occurs with fullCalendar's gcal plugin, but I guess it may also occurs with some other third party libraries.

Here is a JsFiddle example (you'll have to provide a google API key for tests)
https://jsfiddle.net/11tmv4ce/

Just add a breakpoint line 383 of yii.js after first load, then go to previous/next month, you'll see call being cancelled because the option.url is always the same, but options.data differs
